item.description:
"El Ten Eleven is a  Los Angeles,  CA  post-rock duo known for combining guitar/bass  doubleneckor  fretless bass, with heavy  looping, or  vamping, and the utility of an  effects pedal, over  acousticor  electric drumming. They have released four full length albums, earning generally positive reviews.

The band has earned some attention due to many of their songs being featured in the soundtracks of Gary Hustwit's design documentaries  Helvetica  and  Objectified .

The name El Ten Eleven is derived from the name of an airplane, the  Lockheed L-1011 TriStar."  (thank you wikipedia)

El Ten Eleven is an amazing instrumental duo that I've only heard on soundtracks and via the internet.  I'm dying to see them live.  The youTube videos I've seen make me sure this is going to be a great show.

I've yet to visit "the Met", although I've heard great things about the venue that has taken over the space that was previously "the Blackstone."  The location is on Main Street just over the border in Pawtucket.  I'll hang around the back/bar area from 8 until the show starts, after that we'll move up close to see the show.  Hope to see you there!
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a Virginia Tech (VT) baseball cap (orange/maroon either's hard to miss)
item.name: El Ten Eleven at the Met Cafe
